summary: The United States flag, known as the Stars and Stripes, has 13 red and white stripes and a blue square with 50 white stars. The stripes represent the original 13 colonies, and the stars stand for the 50 states. It was first used as a military symbol but gained popularity during the Civil War. The flag's design has evolved over time, with the last change in 1960 when Hawaii became a state. It's now a famous symbol worldwide. People often call it "Old Glory" or the "Star-Spangled Banner."
title: Flag of the United States
